column4: Anybody know how to fix MPlayer errors "initializing video filters (-vf) and video output (-vo)"?
yes when I try to play H264 video. The same video works in Movie Player.
are you using mplayer from command line or GUI like gmplayer?
and I have ubuntu-restriced-extras installed, by the way.
In you open the preferences/options in the mplayer gui, you can select video out device. Try "xv"
When I go to Video tab in Prefs, and highlight xv, I get error: "interrupted by signal 11 in module: unknown" then crash.
actually now it does that after a few seconds of being open, without changing anything. I didn't know it was this bad!
I tried a different format just for test--an avi. same erro about initializing video filters and video output.
try from command line, e.g: "mplayer -vo xv myvideofile.mpg"
it successfully played an OGV file using that method. Now I'll try H264
HEY. It works. That's something. But does that give you a clue what's going on when I start from GUI or how to fix?
your mplayer GUI is segfaulting for some reason, i.e writing outside it's memory. You could try a different mplayer GUI
I thought that GUI was MPlayer. So the GUI is separate? MPlayer is CLI?
